articles.title: Ukraine's EU candidacy will strengthen Europe as Russia threatens freedom - Zelenskiy - Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine signalled on Friday its troops were withdrawing from the city of Sievierodonetsk, scene of weeks of heavy fighting, a move that would be a significant setback in its struggle to defeat Russian forces.

articles.author: Laurence Norman
articles.title: Ukraine Becomes an Official EU Membership Candidate - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: The decision was agreed to by European Union leaders at a summit in Brussels and fulfills one of Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s biggest requests of European countries.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: European Union unanimously approves Ukraine's candidacy for membership - 9News
articles.description: The European Union has agreed to put Ukraine on a path toward EU membership.

articles.title: Germany triggers gas alarm stage, accuses Russia of 'economic attack' - Reuters
articles.description: Germany triggered the "alarm stage" of its emergency gas plan on Thursday in response to falling Russian supplies but stopped short of allowing utilities to pass on soaring energy costs to customers in Europe's largest economy.

articles.author: Lenin Ndebele
articles.title: Eswatini: 'Winter revolution' cripples international company, locals affected - News24
articles.description: Eswatini's "winter revolution" has derailed a European Union-funded project as pro-democracy groups push for the abdication of King Mswati III.
articles.content:
• Inyatsi Construction's European Union-funded water harvesting project is in limbo after attacks.
  • The company has been forced to shut down after three terror attacks this year.

articles.title: Germany faces gas supply 'crisis,' declares alarm level - World News - Castanet.net
articles.description: Germany activated the second phase of its three-stage emergency plan for natural gas supplies Thursday, saying Europe's biggest economy faces a “crisis” and warning that storage targets for the winter are at risk due to dwindling deliveries from Russia.
